title.narrative: The emergency food response for the new IDPs in NW Syria

description.narrative:
The proposed project aims to improve the access of 21600 of most vulnerable groups of IDPs newly displaced from the countryside of Idleb and Aleppo (4160 men , 4480 women , 6105 boys , 6855 girls)especially children , women, people with disabilities and the elderly, to emergency proper safe access to food for six months(3600 beneficiaries in each month) in the modality of cooked meals and raising the awareness on public and personal hygiene issue making use of Saed kitchens assets and previous experience. . The modality of response was designed in a way suitable for the new IDPs who are not able to cook (food making) basing on their self-abilities, whether for lacking cooking fuel, enough cooking spaces or food raw materials where each beneficiary will receive two cooked meals per day (breakfast amp lunch) and cover 100% of the daily needs of the individual, ranging from 2148 to 2242 calories and with the average of 2207 calories in line with the standards of WHO and nutrition sector
This will be done by constructing and operating one kitchen with the capacity of 7200 meals per day to 3600 beneficiaries(2 meals to each beneficiary per day)
The meals will be prepared according to a weekly program where this program will achieve a variety of cooked meals basing on the standards of Sphere in the amount of protein and fat taking into account the percentage of calcium in each meal for the health of pregnant and lactating mothers and be compatible with the culture of the beneficiaries and their habits with the possibility of changing the meals according to the feedback from the beneficiaries. After cooking the meals and packaging them in the kitchens, SCA will move them to the to the sites of IDPs and distribute the cooked meals in coordination with the committees representing the beneficiaries
The project will target the new displaced IDPs in the new established IDP sites(three months and less) under Dana and Maaret Tamsrin sub-districts who don’t have access to food assistance from any sources , cooking tools , capacity to purchase food depending on themselves in the locations defined basing on the needs assessment with much focus on the female headed HHs , households headed by the people with disabilities and other vulnerable groups.
This project is designed in a flexible way that work sites and beneficiaries can be changed according to the changes that may occur in the context, especially the new IDPs who move between several sites in the first weeks of displacement. This project can respond to any expected needs of displacements coordination with FSL Cluster.
